data.title: Site Classes — Sharon Playhouse
data.text:
The Sharon Playhouse welcomes everyone, young and old, to explore the magic of the performing arts through classes and intensives offered throughout the school year.

Timeline:

Fall Semester (7 weeks)

The Fall semester of classes runs from the beginning of October through mid-November. Registration for the Fall semester happens in September.

Winter Workshops

In January and February we offer a handful of Winter Workshops, including masterclasses, camps, and special events. Registration for Winter Workshops happens in December.

Spring Semester (7 weeks)

The Spring semester of classes runs from mid-March through the beginning of May. Registration for the Spring semester happens in February.

Examples of Classes for Kids:

Movement for Munchkins, Music for Munchkins, Creative Theatrics, Creative Movement, Acting for Kids, Ballet Basics, Let’s Dance, Let’s Sing, Theater Jazz, Youth Tap, Clowning, Costume Design, Stage Combat, Fun with Theater Masks, Shakespeare

Examples of Classes for Teens and Adults:

Beginner Tap, Intermediate Tap, Theater Jazz, Mindful Movement, Performing the Monologue, Scene Study, Shakespeare, Acting the Song, Sing How You Speak, The Actor’s Gym, Acting for Television and Film, Improv, How to Audition for a Play, How to Audition for a Musical, Playwriting, Adult Comedy Night, Play Soiree

Examples of Intensives:

1-Day Performing Arts Camps

Masterclass in Theater Confidence with Broadway actor and playwright Douglas Lyons

Masterclass in Sound Design with Tony-nominated Sound Designer Dan Moses Schreier

MOVEMENT FOR MUNCHKINS

YOUTH (AGES 3-5)

SATURDAYS: MARCH 23, 30, APRIL 6, 13, 20, 27, MAY 4

10:00-10:45 AM

INSTRUCTOR: TRICIA DESARIO

Movement for Munchkins is designed to align with the developmental milestones of children ages 3-5 years. Led by Tricia DeSario, an instructor with a background in early childhood development and dance, our 7-week program focuses on nurturing both language development and motor skills through fun songs and movement! Egg shakers, scarves, parachute play and more will be used to facilitate creative movement and socialization among our Munchkins as we gather for circle time songs, interactive story-telling, and explore different movement concepts together. Grownups are warmly encouraged to join their Munchkin in a shared experience of creating community while supporting your preschoolers' development with dance moves they’ll come to know and love! Students are encouraged to also sign up for Music for Munchkins, and will be supervised by teaching artists during the transition from 10:45-11:00 AM.

7 classes: $130

Classes in The Bok (16 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

MUSIC FOR MUNCHKINS

YOUTH (AGES 3-5)

SATURDAYS: MARCH 23, 30, APRIL 6, 13, 20, 27, MAY 4

11:00-11:45 AM

INSTRUCTOR: BECKIE WALLACE

Introduce your 3, 4, and 5-year-olds to the power and joy of music-making. Music for Munchkins will build on your child's natural enthusiasm for music and will provide a strong foundation for future instruction in singing, dance, and/or instrument study. This class will be a joyful opportunity for youngsters to come together and make music, all while learning the basics of rhythm and sound. Students are encouraged to also sign up for Movement for Munchkins, and will be supervised by teaching artists during the transition from 10:45-11:00 AM.

7 classes: $130

Classes in The Bok (16 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

CREATIVE THEATRICS

YOUTH (AGES 6-8)

WEDNESDAYS: MARCH 20, 27, APRIL 3, 10, 17, 24, MAY 1

3:45-4:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: PATRICK DOUGHERTY

Calling all tiny thespians and drama dreamers! Creative Theatrics is throwing open the curtain on a world of playful pretend, silly songs, and imagination explosions! New friends, big laughs, and endless creativity await! Students are encouraged to also sign up for Creative Movement, and will be supervised by teaching artists during the transition from 4:30-4:45 PM.

7 classes: $130

Classes in The Bok (18 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

SINGING 101

YOUTH (AGES 8-12)

SATURDAYS: MARCH 23, 30, APRIL 6, 13, 20, 27, MAY 4

12:30-1:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: BECKIE WALLACE

Join musician and local voice teacher, Beckie Wallace, for The Sharon Playhouse's group vocal class, Singing 101! Beckie offers an approachable technique to healthy singing that focuses on developing well-rounded musicianship and mindful vocal production. Classes will feature vocal warm ups, ensemble singing, and solo singing, all helping to strengthen your individual skill set. You'll also receive tips on how to succeed in your future singing auditions! All levels of experience are welcome! This is a great class to pair with Dancing 101 and/or Acting 101!

7 classes: $140

Classes in The Bok (18 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

DANCING 101

YOUTH (AGES 8-12)

SATURDAYS: MARCH 23, 30, APRIL 6, 13, 20, 27, MAY 4

1:30-2:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: GEORGINA BATES

Get ready to groove and shine in Dancing 101! Master cool moves and groove to upbeat music as you unleash your inner star in this fun and creative dance class! Whether your child is a seasoned dancer or just starting out, this class is the perfect place to explore their talent and have a blast moving their body! New students and returning students are encouraged to sign up! This is a great class to pair with Singing 101 and/or Acting 101!

7 classes: $140

Classes in The Bok (18 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

ACTING 101

YOUTH (AGES 8-12)

SATURDAYS: MARCH 23, 30, APRIL 6, 13, 20, 27, MAY 4

2:30-3:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: PATRICK DOUGHERTY

Lights, Camera, Action! Unleash Your Inner Star in Acting 101! In this electrifying acting class, your imagination takes center stage! Students will have a blast embarking on adventures, transforming into wacky characters, and bringing their wildest ideas to life! Class sessions will include theater games, improv, movement exercises, and scene study. Enroll your child today and watch their star power explode! This is a great class to pair with Singing 101 and/or Dancing 101!

7 classes: $140

Classes in The Bok (18 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

TEEN PLAY MAKING LAB

YOUTH/TEEN (AGES 12-18)

SATURDAYS: MARCH 23, 30, APRIL 6, 13, 20, 27, MAY 4

4:00-5:30 PM

INSTRUCTORS: ANDRUS NICHOLS AND DREW LEDBETTER

Dive into multiple elements of play-making through a guided and fun collaborative process! This theatrical journey will include dramaturgy/script analysis, directing, lighting/sound design, and performance. Sink your teeth into powerful monologues and captivating scenes - handpicked to stretch your emotional range and spark your imagination. Each participant will be encouraged to embrace playful exploration and a deep, focused, rehearsal process. A script, a group of imaginative artists, some lights, and an audience is all you need! This seven week course will result in a "workshop style” production for public sharing.

7 classes: $200

Classes in the Bok (18 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

CHOREOGRAPHY WORKSHOP

YOUTH (AGES 8-12)

FRIDAY, APRIL 26

4:00-6:00 PM

INSTRUCTOR: KIMIYE CORWIN

Ever dream of calling the shots like Beyoncé's choreographer or seeing your moves in a music video? In this electrifying workshop, unleash your inner dance boss and create your own hip-hop masterpiece alongside Kimiye Corwin! Warm up with killer hip-hop basics and other funky moves that'll get your body groovin'! Brainstorm epic themes and movement ideas with your fellow dancers to build a showstopping group piece that will blow everyone away! Family members and friends are welcome to come to a viewing of what is created in the last 20 minutes of class. No experience needed, just the love for music, movement, and making something awesome with your squad!

1 Workshop: $45

In The Bok (16 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

SHARON PLAYHOUSE 1-DAY CAMP

YOUTH (AGES 8-13)

MONDAY: APRIL 15

9:30 AM -3:30 PM

INSTRUCTORS: MICHAEL KEVIN BALDWIN AND SARAH CUOCO

When school is out, The Sharon Playhouse is in! Spend part of your spring break with the Playhouse education power-duo of Michael Kevin Baldwin and Sarah Cuoco, along with local voice teacher Beckie Wallace, for an invigorating day of theater fun! This specialized 1-day camp will include theater games, vocal training, heart-pumping choreography, and acting exercises, all led by three professional Teaching Artists. You won’t want to miss this jam-packed day celebrating the performing arts!

1 Full Day of Camp: $130

Camp in The Bok (22 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

BEGINNER TAP

TEEN/ADULT (AGES 13 & UP)

WEDNESDAYS: MARCH 20, 27, APRIL 3, 10, 17, 24, MAY 1

6:00-7:00 PM

INSTRUCTOR: SARAH CUOCO

This beginner tap class is designed for joyful movers who are curious to explore the rhythm and magic of tap dancing. Warm-up exercises will get you energized and ready to tap, while fun routines will enhance your coordination, balance, and rhythm. No prior experience needed, just a spark of enthusiasm and a smile. This is more than just a class, it's a community! Join us for an hour of laughter, learning, and tapping your night away.

7 classes: $140

Classes in The Bok (20 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

JAZZ DANCE

TEEN/ADULT (AGES 13 & UP)

WEDNESDAYS: MARCH 20, 27, APRIL 3, 10, 17, 24, MAY 1

7:15-8:15 PM

INSTRUCTOR: SARAH CUOCO

Get ready to groove, sweat, and smile! This class is your chance to release stress, build confidence, and add some serious fun to your life. No prior experience needed! Whether you're a seasoned dancer or just starting out, Sarah believes everyone can find joy in jazz and will guide you with patience and enthusiasm. Learn upbeat routines inspired by Broadway hits and chart-topping pop anthems, keeping you energized and engaged. Every class is a new adventure!

7 classes: $140

Classes in The Bok (20 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

ACTING FOR TV AND FILM

TEEN/ADULT (AGES 15 & UP)

THURSDAYS: MARCH 21, 28, APRIL 4, 11, 18, 25, MAY 9

6:30-8:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: CAROLINE KINSOLVING

This intensive 7-week course dives into the real world of TV and Film acting, led by Caroline Kinsolving, an actress with over 20 years experience on stage and screen. Learn the secrets of navigating set life, develop the skills and presence to captivate the lens, and gain invaluable knowledge from both sides of the camera. Students will be assigned scenes from TV and Film and will develop the skills and insights needed to act in front of the camera. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn and grow from this screen and stage professional!

7 Classes: $200

In the Bok (16 participants maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

STUDYING THE SCENE

TEEN/ADULT (AGES 15 & UP)

TUESDAYS: MARCH 19, 26, APRIL 2, 9, 16, 23, 30

6:30-8:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: RICKY OLIVER

Sharpen your acting instrument and ignite your passion for storytelling in our immersive Scene Study class! This course, taught by one of Sharon Playhouse’s fabulous new Teaching Artists, Ricky Oliver, offers a unique opportunity to dissect, explore, and breathe life into powerful scenes from a diverse range of plays. You will be assigned a scene that aligns with your interests and career goals, be it classical drama, contemporary comedies, or thought-provoking new plays. Throughout the seven-week process, you will work alongside dedicated scene partners and a supportive instructor, fostering trust and vulnerability for truthful performances. The semester will culminate with a final presentation in which you will share your honed skills and newfound understanding of character with your peers and invited guests.

7 Classes: $200

In The Bok (16 participants maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

PLAYWRITING

TEEN/ADULT (AGES 15 & UP)

MONDAYS: MARCH 18, 25, APRIL 1, 8, 15, 22, 29

6:30-8:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: JULIE RETZLAFF

Spark your inner Shakespeare and craft your own 10-minute masterpiece in this dynamic playwriting course! Join Julie Retzlaff for this in-person Playwriting experience that will explore the building-blocks of theatrical writing in order to craft your own 10-minute play. Explore ideation, character-building, and plot mastery – the secret ingredients of captivating plays. Workshop your scenes in a supportive environment, receiving expert feedback, and honing your craft. Whether you're a seasoned pro, a curious newcomer, or hoping to apply to Sharon Playhouse’s Writers’ Playground, this course is for you!

7 Classes: $200

In The Bok (15 participants maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

HOW TO BE A WORKING ACTOR

TEEN/ADULT (AGES 15 & UP)

FRIDAY, MARCH 29

5:00-6:30 PM

INSTRUCTOR: JENNA LEIGH MILLER

Are you asking yourself, “How do I make it as an actor?” Join Jenna Leigh Miller, working actor and social media manager (seen in Oliver! at The Sharon Playhouse), in this power-packed workshop designed to bridge the gap between dream and reality. This class provides you with career strategies that help generate audition opportunities and skills that increase your ability to get BOOKED! Learn the savvy marketing strategies needed to build your brand and stand out from the crowd. Get financial advice and discover smart ways to sustain your acting journey. Sign up today and start turning your acting dreams into reality!

1 Workshop: $40

In The Bok (16 students maximum)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER
